details.content: The passion of the Indian fans wherever their team is playing is so inspiring ; A #ChakDeIndia moment from the Oval. (AP)

details.title: Toss
details.content: India won the toss and choose to bowl.

It all boils down to this, one last contest between arch-rivals India and Pakistan. The men in blue cantered to the summit clash while the men in green fought their way through with brilliant upsets. What are the chances that India will defend their trophy smooth as they’ve been throughout the tournament? And what are the chances Pakistan might pull off one last upset?

details.title: Toss
details.content: India win the toss and choose to bowl.

details.title: Toss
details.content: Virat Kohli chooses to bowl first.

details.title: Pakistan XI
details.content: Azhar Ali, Fakhar Zaman, Babar Azam, Mohammad Hafeez, Shoaib Malik, Sarfraz Ahmed,Imad Wasim, Mohammad Amir, Shadab Khan, Hasan Ali, Junaid Khan

details.title: Pakistan team remains unchanged
Time for the National Anthems
details.content: Emotions engulf the Oval as players from both the teams take the field for the national anthems!

details.title: Men in Blue !

details.content:
Sir Jadeja takes to twitter for some banter:

 

50% Of The TV Sets Have Already Been Broken After TOSS. Coz They Know Daddy #Kohli Chases Like A BOSS#INDvPAK #INDvsPAK #PAKvIND #PAKvsIND

— Sir Jadeja (@SirJadeja) June 18, 2017

details.title: Time for some quick stats!
details.content: This is the 9th time India has made it to the finals of an ICC event proving their dominance on the world stage where they ended on a winning note on five occassions.

﻿India and Pakistan have clashed on English soil on four different occassions, winning three of them. India has always enjoyed an overwhelming success at the oval where they have a winning percentage of 35.71% as cmpared to their rivals, who have a meagre 22.22% in ODIs.

 

﻿

Excitement has been in the air for the past two days, and India, Pakistan cricket fans are just going crazy! Experts feel that today’s final is going to be a battle between India’s batting and Pakistan’s bowling, especially in the middle overs. So, gear up for a cracking contest between the bat and the ball!

details.title: It's almost time!
details.content: The Pakistan openers warms up as the Indian fielders take their positions in the field.
Pakistan openers Fakhar Zaman and Azhar Ali take the field.

details.title: And off we go
details.content: Azhar Ali leaves the first ball from Bhuveneshwar Kumar, as the crowd roars.

details.title: Over 1 - Pak 0/0
details.content: Bhuveneshwar Kumar keeps Azhar Ali quiet, starting off with a maiden. A tidy over from India's most dependable bowler.
Jasprit Bumrah starts from the other end with Fakhar Zaman taking strike.

details.title: Over 2 - Pak 3/0
details.content: And both batsmen are off the mark with singles. Jasprit Bumrah looking good except for a wide.

details.title: Bhuvneshwar the name !
details.content: Begins the game with a maiden. Bhuvi.

details.title: Over 3 - Pak 7/0
details.content: A chance of a run out missed in that over by Kedar Jadhav! So Close!

details.title: Wicket off a no-ball!
details.content: Very unfortunate for India as Jasprit Bumrah oversteps and Fakhar Zaman edges one to the keeper!

details.title: Indian fans right now be like:
details.content: via GIPHY
The wicket doesn't count. But, it's all happening here!
First convincing shot of the game from Azhar Ali. A classic straight drive from him for the second boundary of the over.
Turning out to be an expensive over for India. Three extras in the over.

details.title: Over 4 - Pak 19/0
details.content: Two boundaries off that eventful over. Pakistan are looking good.

Just a reminder of stats for our readers. When it comes to overall tournament finals, Pakistan have always fared better, having a winning percentage of 42.86, with India not far behind at 40.32%. The recent form of India has been quite good, with Virat Kohli's side winning 7 of their last 10 encounters whereas Pakistan have equal share of wins and losses managing to win only 5 of their last 10 encounters.
Bouncer hits Azhar Ali's head and goes off to boundary !
A bouncer hits Fakhar Zaman's helmet and races to the boundary.

details.title: Over 5 - Pak 27/0
details.content: Two expensive overs from India and they are under pressure. Fakhar Zaman is slowly opening up.
Bumrah seems to be running in with nerves, is bowling too many extras.
Pakistan batsmen are settling down and the boundaries just keep coming.

details.title: Over 6 - Pak 36/0
details.content: The Indian bowlers are under pressure, as Azhar and Zaman look to up the scoring.
A quick run! A throw at the stumps! Misses by an inch!

details.title: Over 7 - Pak 38/0
details.content: A quieter over but the Pakistan openers are looking to really dominate the Indians.
Pakistani fans seem to be enjoying the game at the moment.
Azhar Ali has had an impressive run at the Champions Trophy this year, with a best score of 76*.

details.title: Bowling change
details.content: R Ashwin brought into the attack. (AP)

details.title: First six of the final !
details.content: Azhar Ali comes down the pitch and drives one straight over mid-on for a six!

details.title: Over 8 - Pak 48/0
details.content: Pakistan nearing fifty now, Azhar Ali and Fakhar Zaman show no signs of slowing down.

Well said. #INDvPAK #CT17 Picture: AFP pic.twitter.com/gr4EtZE7FN

— Xpress_Sports (@Xpress_Sports) June 18, 2017
Pakistan are going at a run rate of 6 an over. The projected score now is 300. But, Pakistan will surely look to get more than 300.

details.title: Fifty up for Pak
details.content: Azhar sweeps Ashwin for four and brings the 50 for his team.

details.title: Over 10 - Pak 55/0
details.content: That's 10 overs done and the Pakistani openers look settled. India badly need a wicket now to pull their rivals back.

5 overs for 10 from @BhuviOfficial is as good a new ball spell as any, especially in a final. Other end 4 overs for 38

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017
Jasprit Bumrah gets a second spell, Kohli holds back on Hardik Pandya.

50 partnership up as Pakistan make a bright start v India.

LIVE: https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/FFh8Dkze8c

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017
Powerplay 2 now under way. Azhar begins with a very straight drive for FOUR.

5 overs for 10 from @BhuviOfficial is as good a new ball spell as any, especially in a final. Other end 4 overs for 38

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: Over 11 - Pak 63/0
details.content: It's a tug-of-war here as Indian bowlers look to put the Pakistan openers, who are trying to get free, under pressure.

details.title: Over 12 - Pak 69/0
details.content: Ashwin can't keep Azhar down, as the batsman goes after him.
The Men In Blue definitely need a breakthrough!!!!
Fakhar Zaman is dynamic at the top, with the calm, calculated Azhar Ali at the other end. The partnership building up now, not too far from a hundred.
Good running from Pakistan as Bumrah looks on scratching his head.

details.title: Over 13 - Pak 74/0
details.content: India desperate for wickets now. Will there be a bowling change next?
Ashwin continues. Virat tries to be aggressive with a slip in place, but the Pakistan batsmen look completely at ease.
Ashwin continues. Virat tries to be aggressive with a slip in place, but the Pakistan batsmen look completely at ease.

Running been a bit frantic. Another day a few run-outs by now.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017
India's homework for Zaman is very evident bowlers refuse to give him room.

details.title: Over 14 - Pak 77/0
details.content: India has done their homework for Zaman. Bowlers refuse to give him room by giving straight deliveries to the body. But, may be a change in bowling is needed. Is it a good time to perhaps bring in Ravindra Jadeja?
And finally, there's a change in bowling! Hardik Pandya steps in and is looking good.

details.title: Bowling change
details.content: Can Hardik Pandya deliver the much needed breakthrough for the defending champions ? (AP)
This Pakistani side seems to be a completely different from the one steamrolled by India in the previous encounter.

details.title: Over 15 - Pak 86/0
details.content: Fakhar Zaman is getting more confident, just didn't let Pandya settle down. A boundary to finish off that over.
Change in bowling at both ends. Ravindra Jadeja starts his spell now.
Pakistan are playing intelligently, just the right amount of energy as runs flow freely. The pressure on India taking a toll on the bowlers.
Its great news for the Indian fans as Indian badminton ace Kidambi Srikanth beats Kazumasa Sakai 21-11, 21-19 to lift the Indonesia Open Super Series...Surely a victory to rejoice...

details.title: Over 16 - Pak 90/0
details.content: Just 10 away now from a century stand. Azhar and Zaman are complementing each other really well. India must break this partnership if they want to get back in the game.

Pakistan have made the most of their opportunities. This is an excellent start for them now.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017
Good fielding by Yuvraj Singh. That positivity and support is just what his team's bowlers need now.

details.title: Five bowlers tried and still no wicket. Pak fans:
details.content: via GIPHY
Azhar Ali makes a little bit of room, edges one straight up into the sky. But, the ball lands in the no man's land. Lady luck is certainly in Pakistan's favour today.

details.title: Over 17 - Pak 93/0
details.content: Pakistan are looking solid.

Moment of Pride!
#KidambiSrikanth clinches his 3rd Super Series title with 21-11, 21-19 win over Japan's Kazumasa Sakai🏸 in #IndonesiaOpen pic.twitter.com/YNz8jGvDtM

— ALL INDIA RADIO (@AkashvaniAIR) June 18, 2017

details.title: Drinks Break
details.content: Skipper Kohli should be deperate for some ...

Excellent start boys...Keep going let's get to a 300 plus score now. #PAKvIND

— Shahid Afridi (@SAfridiOfficial) June 18, 2017
Jadeja back on after drinks.

details.title: Over 18 - Pak 96/0
details.content: The btasmen play it safe just after drinks. Azhar Ali inching to his half century now.
A great bit of fielding by Jadeja, saves a boundary and almost manages to hit the wicket at the non-striker's end for a run out.

details.title: Milestone
details.content: Azhar Ali and Fakhar Zaman: Highest opening partnership by Pakistan against India in any ICC world tournament.

details.title: Hundred up without the losing a wicket
details.content: Kudos to the Pakistan openers.

details.title: Over 19 - Pak 103/0
details.content: A century stand for the openers and Pakistan are looking strong. Will they try to up the run rate now? The projected score at the current rate is 277. They'll be wanting more than that.

details.title: Burn haters burn !
details.content: Wanted to see Pakistan getting bullied, get to see "the Pak storm"  instead !!

details.title: This is hilarious
details.content:
We hope you like sleeping on the couch#PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/Ni5siGZGeT

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

The boundaries are the key to this partnership. Azhar Ali has been excellent.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: Demolition man
details.content: Fifty up for Azhar Ali. (AP)

details.title: And Fakhar joins the party
details.content: Sever boundaries as he brings up his fifty. good going Zaman. (AP)

50s for @AzharAli_ and Fakhar Zaman!https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/9LpJugHOpn

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: Over 20 - Pak 114/0
details.content: Both the openers reached half centuries now and if even one of them get a hundred, then India are going to be in big trouble.

details.title: Over 21 - Pak 118/0
details.content: And the green brigade are motoring on nicely.

details.title: Over 22 - Pak 125/0
details.content: The Men in Blue must be regretting that no-ball by Bumrah as Zaman reaches 54 runs. Two boundaries off that over.
Ashwin is back into the attack. He looked very defensive before. Will he change it up to get the breakthrough his captain needs?

details.title: Young fans in INDIA
details.content:
📸 Young @BCCI fans in @imVkohli masks watch on from India #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/GSuM91UUn6

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: Azhar is gone
details.content: The opening partnership has been finally broken at 128.

details.title: WICKET! Azhar Ali 59
details.content: Ball-watching costs him as Azhar ends up being a mile away from the crease, giving enough time fro MS Dhoni to knock off the bails with the throw from Bumrah.
Azhar Ali 59 (71b 6x4 1x6) SR: 83.09

details.title: Over 23 - Pak 128/1
details.content: Can the breakthrough breathe life into the Indian bowlers? A well-played fifty from Azhar has set the perfect platform for Pakistan.

details.title: Over 24 - 129/1
details.content: The new man in is Babar Azam. Just 1 run off that Jadeja over as the spinner keeps it tight for Zaman.

details.title: Meanwhile in Indian dugout
details.content: via GIPHY

The run-out was on the cards!!

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: Fakhar you beast !

details.content: Fakhar Zaman hits a HUUUUGGGGGGEEEEEEEEE SSSSSIIIIIXXXXXXXXXX.......

details.title: Over 25 - Pak 134/1
details.content: Babar Azam gets off the mark.

details.title: Over 26 - Pak 150/1
details.content: 16 runs off that over! A big one for Pakistan. Fakhar Zaman finding his form. Two lovely sixes.

details.title: Admit it
details.content: They deserve a standing ovation for stepping up when it mattered the most.
Ashwin bowls the worst over (so far!!) as he goes for 16 runs.

details.title: Over 27 - Pak 167/1
details.content: Azhar Ali's dismissal only seems to have let Fakhar Zaman loose! India need to find a way to stem the bleeding.

Fakhar Zaman needed to ride his luck. He is now. This is an awesome surface to bat on.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017
Hardik Pandya brought back into the attack..India desperately are in need of a wicket..
Fakhar Zaman in the nervous nineties now. That no-ball has cost them far too much.

details.title: Over 28 - Pak 175/1
details.content: Just a six away from the hundred mark now for Zaman.

details.title: Any minute now...

details.content: After that Azhar Ali run-out, Zaman has scored 39 off 26. Amazing positivity.

details.title: Over 29 - Pak 176/1
details.content: A very quiet over after long. Just one run off it. Zaman is yet to reach his hundred.
Partnership for Pakistan's second wicket is now heading to 50.
Pandya looks in good form with the ball as his perfect line and length coupled with a slight swing misses Babar Azam's bat.
Ashwin brought back now.

details.title: Over 30 - Pak 179/1
details.content: That's the end of 30th over. Pakistan are still on top.

A maiden ODI 100 for Fakhar Zaman! What a time for the @TheRealPCB opener to do it!https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/QWUlaox6qn

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: Take a bow - Fakhar Zaman scores a ton
details.content: What a splendid innings from the young opener; somply WOAHH !! (AP)

details.title: Speechless

details.content:
Have to admire this century from Fakhar Zaman. Tense game, big occasion and he has shown he has arrived.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: Meanwhile Virendar Sehwag
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 31 - Pak 186/1
details.content: It's just the 31st over and Pakistan are already closing in on 200. Fakhar Zaman seems to be running away with the game. India need a wicket if they want to get back in the contest.

Standing ovation from all parts of the ground for Fakhar Zaman after his superb knock

🇵🇰👏 Standing ovation from all parts of the ground for Fakhar Zaman after his superb 💯#PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/0hEV0Xu1r6

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017
"All the runs that he scores after his century will show his character," says Sanjay Manjrekar about young Fakhar Zaman.

details.title: Over 32 - Pak 189/1
details.content: The green brigade are just running away with it! India needs to find someone who can turn this around with perhaps a bit of magic. Kedar Jadhav, anyone?
Fakhar starts the over with a six!
Ashwin is under pressure as Zaman seems to put him away very easily.

That guy Fakhar is making India pay for that NoBall.. what a difference he's been for Pakistan...#INDvPAK #ct17 320+ would be needed

— Daren Sammy (@darensammy88) June 18, 2017

details.title: Over 33 - Pak 200/1
details.content: Pakistan reach 200. They would be looking for 350 now.

details.title: Fakhar falls
details.content: One of the finest catches you are ever likely to see ...

details.title: WICKET Fakhar Zaman 114 (106)
details.content: And India has got their break! Jadeja made a difficult catch look easy! Pandya does the job for his captain!
Clearing the boundary is one thing and beating the Indian fielders another!! Hats off to Sir Jadeja for that amazing catch.
The new man in is the experienced Shoaib Malik.

details.title: Over 34 - Pak 202/2
details.content: A brilliant over from Pandya! Just two runs off it and the dangerous Zaman is gone.
Bumrah is back in. Kohli is trying to squeeze him in after his bad spell today. Will Pakistan go after him?

details.title: FOUR
details.content: And Bumrah's woes continue. Babar Azam gets his first boundary.

details.title: Over 35 - Pak 209/2
details.content: Seven off that over. One more wicket will be good for India.

If Pakistan strikes at this rate, the target for India would be around  330-350. Seems like a really tough climax is up for this game! 

- Aashin Thampy, Ernakulam

details.title: FOUR
details.content: Stand and deliver on the front foot! Malik gets his first boundary.

details.title: Over 36 - Pak 216/2
details.content: Pakistan are pushing on. With wickets in hand, the green brigade are looking to go all out.

details.title: FORM IS TEMPORARY, CLASS IS PERMENANT
Over 37 - Pak 227/2
details.content: Another expensive over, this time from Jadeja. India is struggling to stem the flow of runs.

details.title: Over 38 - Pak 239/2
details.content: Pandya ends his spell, definitely a bit on the expensive side today, but he got the important wicket of the dangerous Zaman.

"This is clever from Pakistan. One batsman taking the lead, the other playing himself in. Haven't had two new batsmen in."

-Harsha Bhogle
Kedhar Jadhav comes in to bowl. Can he produce some magic like last time?

10-0-53-1 on this surface is excellent from @hardikpandya7

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: BOWLING CHANGE
details.content: Hoping for another double-strike ... (fb/kedarjadhavindia ) (AP)
Experts say it's a good wicket to bat on. So, even 300 would be chaseable for India.

details.title: Over 39 - Pak 246/2
details.content: Just four away from the 250 mark, and they have 8 wickets in hand. Pakistan have a good platform to go all out there and launch from.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar brought into the attack to contain the run rate, and get a breakthrough.

details.title: BHUVI STRIKES
details.content: Want a wicket ? Call me maybe ! (AP)

details.title: WICKET Shoaib Malik 12 (16)
details.content:
Bhuveneshwar Kumar you beauty! Malik scoops one for an easy catch by Jadhav! The experienced batsmen failed, trying to go after the bowling.

WICKET!

Shoaib Malik caught in the deep by Kedar Jadhav.

Pakistan 247/3https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/bKiYgmK0Ew

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017
Its surprising to see Mohammad Hafeez coming to bat ahead of skipper Sarfraz Ahmed...

details.title: Over 40 - Pak 247/3
details.content: It's going to be the last ten overs now! Can India push Pakistan back with quick strikes or will Pakistan just take off now?
Babar Azam quietly inching towards a half century, at 44 now.

details.title: Over 41 - Pak 257/3
details.content: Ten runs off that over. If Pakistan keep this up, they can easily make it to 300.
Pakistani fans rejoice as Hafeez sweeps another ball for four. Great start for the right-hander.

Pakistan playing their heart out it seems. Ashwin dealing in wides.

- Rahul Narayan, Perumbavoor

details.title: Over 42 - Pak 266/3
details.content: Pakistan marching on with a healthy run rate. Mohammad Hafeez joins the party now. India need a breakthrough.

details.title: YUVI GOT SAFE HANDS
details.content: Babar departs for 46, Jadhav strikes.

details.title: WICKET Babar Azam 46 (52)
details.content: And he misses out on a half century! Babar Azam loops it into the air giving an easy catch for Yuvraj SIngh at mid-off.
The next one in for Pakistan is the English-born Imad Wasim.

details.title: NEW MAN IN
details.content: Can Imad Wasim be the perfect partner Hafeez wants ? (AP)
Biggest stage in the career of the Swansea-born after a successsfull U-19 WC campaign.

details.title: Over 43 - Pak 270/4
details.content: Pakistan are steadily going up but wickets are beginning to fall at regular intervals. First Malik and then the well-settled Azam.
The projected score now is 316 but Pakistan should be looking at at least 330.
Hafeez and Imad seem to have switched into run-a-ball mode as they knocks around finding easy singles of J Bumrah.
Imad comes down the ground to send Jadhav flying.

details.title: WONDER WHAT THEY WERE DISCUSSING ABOUT....
details.content:
A meeting of great cricketing minds. #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/IHxIrt0FUf

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

If I get excited by watching the Pakistan batsmen score six, am I anti- national ?.

- Issac James, Kochi

details.title: Over 44 - Pak 278/4
details.content: Hafeez is trying to up the ante. A four off that over.

details.title: Over 45 - Pak 294/4
details.content: Hafeez thrashes Jadhav! Two huge sixes off that over! India had better find a way to stem the runs!

Mohammad Hafeez is going BIG now!#PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/n8nlwMm5lE

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: Over 46 - Pak 305/4
details.content: And 300 is up for Pakistan in just the 46th over. 350 looking good now.
Bumrah is nicely mixing it up with slow deliveries.
Imad Wasim crunches a loose delivery down the ground for FOUR!

4 overs left. Anything under 340 bonus for India. Pakistan have kept their heads and so their only opponents have been the opposition

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: Over 47 - Pak 313/4
details.content: Can Hafeez drive Pakistan to reach the 350 mark?
A slight hint of tension on skipper Virat Kohli's face.

When your team passes 300 in the #CT17 Final after being sent in by India (and there are still four overs to bat!) 🇵🇰 #PAKvIND pic.twitter.com/sYxck9djTj

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: EXCELLENT OVER FROM BHUVNESHWAR
details.content: Bowling his heart out...(AP)

details.title: Over 48 - Pak 318/4
details.content: A brilliant over from Bhuveneshwar Kumar! Just five off that over! A valuable one for India.

details.title: Indian team - Not sure if cricketers or Ninjas
details.content: via GIPHY
India on the money in the death overs! Bhuvneshwar and Bumrah keeping it nice and tight!
And it's a commentator's curse, Bumrah bowls a no-ball!
Luck is certainly on Pakistan's side: Ball hits wicket but the bails doesn't dislodge.

details.title: FIFTY
details.content: Hafeez quietly reaches a fifty! Very valuable runs for Pakistan.

details.title: Over 49 - Pak 329/4
details.content: It's down to the last over. How much can Pakistan score?

details.title: My name is Hafeez...Mohammad Hafeez...
details.content:
That's 50 for @MHafeez22, coming off just 34 ballshttps://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/2NbwVC4B1i

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017
Hafeez is struggling to get Bhuvneshwar away.
Two dot balls followed by a six. Hafeez determined not to let Bhuvi dominate.
SIX! Hafeez launches one straight down the ground! Playing a gem of an innings here!

details.title: WHAT A BATTING PERFORMANCE BY PAK
Over 50 - Pak 338/4
details.content: A single off the last ball and it is over. Pakistan set India, a target of 339.

Fakhar Zaman's maiden ODI century powers Pakistan to 338/4 in the Final of #CT17.

Will it be enough?https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND pic.twitter.com/rv5UeyBssS

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

"Thand rakho...feel 3 deg cool with cool burst..who do you think will be the #FiamaCoolestManInBlue @FiamaMen #INDvPAK

— Virender Sehwag (@virendersehwag) June 18, 2017
Pakistanis cheer while watching the final on big screen in Lahore. (AP)

"What an innings by Fakhar Zaman. Held his nerve on the big stage. Just what Pakistan needed"

- Kumar Sangakkara

details.title: Innings Break
details.content:
Pakistan post a very competitive total. In a final, there's always an added pressure while chasing. Can the Men in Blue get out there and chase it down?

Well, they certainly have the batting power to do it, with the likes of the tournament's top run-scorer Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharm, Virat Kohli, Yuvraj Singh and MS Dhoni. But, Pakistan's explosive bowlers led by the very dangerous Hassan Ali will look out to rout the rivals out.

Innings Break - 🇵🇰: 338-4 (50 ov) #INDvPAK #CT17 #AikJeetAur pic.twitter.com/jxHJMNpjVp

— PCB Official (@TheRealPCB) June 18, 2017

Rohit and Dhawan need to deliver now.India needs their consistency and big hitting ability more than ever now. They need to be postive here. I have no doubt they can. Meanwhile Pakistan bowlers, for no doubt, will be  trying to reverse the ball. The pitch is definitely gonna able them to do the same.

- Micheal Hussey, former Australian cricketer

details.title: We are back on!
details.content: Pakistan have a team huddle as the Indian openers walk out.

details.title: WICKET Rohit Sharma 0 (3)
details.content: A brilliant delivery from Amir that plump hits the stumps!

Big big blow for India. Amir showing why he is a pedigreed cricketer!

-Harsha Bhogle

details.title: Over 1 - Ind 2/1
details.content: Amir looks to turn it on! Pakistan off to a brilliant start!
Junaid Khan opens from the other end. Two slips for Kohli.

details.title: Over 2 - Ind 4/1
details.content: Kohli and Dhawan play it safe after the wicket of Rohit.
Can the man in form deliver when it matters the most ?

India punishing Pakistan at FIH Hockey World League Semi-Final

HT! India in complete control against Pakistan at the end of the 1st half. #HWL2017 #INDvPAK pic.twitter.com/0w4LltQDeJ

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) June 18, 2017

WICKET!

Gone next ball! Kohli clips it to point. Gone for 5.

India 6/2https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/uOvvbApCru

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

This spell from Amir is reminiscent of the one he bowled in the Asia Cup in Dhaka

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: WICKET Virat Kohli 5 (9)
details.content: Amir strikes again! Kohli chips a simple one to Shadab Khan!

details.title: Over 3 - Ind 7/2
details.content: India in big trouble now. Two down in just three overs! The next man in is Yuvraj Singh. Can he be India's hero today?

Absolute SCENES as Pakistan sends Sharma and Kohli back to the pavilion inside three overs!

LIVE 👉 https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh#PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/C04s2t5ZB1

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017
Yuvraj seems hesistant to stretch for quick-singles.
Dhawan pulls one for four. India needed that.
Well driven by Dhawan!

details.title: Over 4 - Ind 7/2
details.content: Junaid backing up Amir by keeping it tight, a maiden. Yuvraj just can't seem to get the ball away.

details.title: Over 5 - Ind 15/2
details.content: Much-needed boundaries for India from that over. With a big target to chase, India can't afford to go slow.

Remember 23 March 2003?

The Wanderers at Johannesburg. The World Cup Final. Ricky Ponting thrashing the Indian bowlers all around the park, remaining unbeaten at 140 and helping Australia post a formidable 359. And India losing Sachin Tendulkar early in the chase for just four runs. Remember?
 
- Josy Joseph, Changanacherry

details.title: Over 6 - Ind 21/2
details.content: A four from Yuvraj off that over. But, the Indian batsmen look far from comfortable at the crease.
Amir and Junaid are asking all the right questions. Yuvraj seems extremely uncomfortable.

details.title: Over 7 - Ind 22/2
details.content: Just one from that over. Are Amir and Junaid the perfect opening bowling combination for Pakistan?
Shikhar Dhawan carries his form into the final, puts one away from Junaid calmly.
Dhawan fires another one into the boundary line with grace.
And another cracking shot for four from Dhawan !

details.title: Over 8 - Ind 31/2
details.content: A big over that, courtesy the tournament's best batsman for India, Shikhar Dhawan! Yuvraj is still looking rusty though.
Sarfraz Ahmed is yet to use their best bowler, Hassan Ali.

details.title: AMIR AGAIN: DHAWAN DEPARTS
details.content: India in knee-deep trouble as it losses it's most successful batsman of the tournament. (AP)

details.title: WICKET Shikhar Dhawan 21 (22)
details.content: SHIKHAR DHAWAN departs too! Amir gets his third! A routine catch for the keeper! India in real trouble now!

details.title: Over 9 - Ind 33/3
details.content: Pakistan are right on top now! India's lower middle order will be tested today. The next man in is MS Dhoni.

details.title: BOWLING CHANGE
details.content: Can Mohammad Hafeez produce a wonderful all-round performance and seal it for Pakistan ?(AP)
Yuvraj ends the over on a positive note with a beautiful boundary.

details.title: Over 10 - Ind 43/3
details.content: Yuvraj is trying to be positive. If anyone can win this game, the two batsmen at the crease can!

details.title: Somewhere before a TV in Delhi:
details.content: via GIPHY

Well, this was the conversation wasn't it? What if the top 3, who have batted so much, fail on the big day? Time to test depth.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: Over 11 - Ind 47/3
details.content: A maiden from Amir. Pakistan are not allowing any space for India to try and break free.

details.title: TASK IN HAND
details.content: Can Hassan Ali defy the experience of Yuvraj Singh ? (AP)
Brilliant fielding by Fakhar Zaman to save a sure four. The fielders are backing up their bowlers. Pakistan are giving it their all, out there!

Well, this was the conversation wasn't it? What if the top 3, who have batted so much, fail on the big day? Time to test depth.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: Over 12 - Ind 50/3
details.content: India painstakingly reach the 50 mark. Dhoni and Yuvraj are looking to build up a steady partnership.

India decimates Pakistan

FT! India completes a hat-trick of win's with a dominating performance over Pakistan in the Hero Men's #HWL2017 SF in London on 18th Jun. pic.twitter.com/JcX9Vhkrpd

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) June 18, 2017
It is Shadab's charisma against Dhoni's experience.
Bowling change at both ends. Shadab Khan and Hassan Ali are on. Amir and Junaid have done the damage though.

details.title: REVIEW
details.content: A big shout from Shadab for LBW!! Captain Sarfraz agrees to review.

details.title: WICKET Yuvraj Singh 22 (31)
details.content: Shadab khan gets it right! Ball tracker shows that the ball would have hit middle stump plump!! Yuvraj walks off in dismay.

details.title: MAN WITH HAWK EYES
details.content: A confident Shadab successfully challenged the umpire's decision to dismiss Yuvraj Singh; big wicket for Pakistan. (AP)

details.title: Over 13 - Ind 54/4
details.content: India are in deep trouble!! Pakistan are just eating up the Indian batsmen!

details.title: Uh-ohh ..
details.content: via GIPHY

WICKET!

MS Dhoni caught by Imad Wasim in the deep with a great catch.

India 54/5https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/tPuaVDtPX3

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: WICKET MS Dhoni 4 (16)
details.content: Hassan Ali joins the party too!! MS Dhoni scoops one up as Imad Wasim dives to take the catch! Dhoni never got going today.

details.title: Over 14 - Ind 55/5
details.content: A triple 5 that India will not be proud of! This is a huge collapse!
Is India's weak middle order exposed today?

details.title: FOUR
details.content: Finally, relief for India as Jadhav sends one to the boundary. They're going to need many more of these!
Resistance ?

details.title: Over 15 - Ind 62/5
details.content: Jadhav and Pandya have a huge job to do.

<iframe src="https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fnavmivjkn%2Fposts%2F10209500950784174&width=500" width="100%" height="161" style="border:none;overflow:hidden" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowTransparency="true"></iframe>

details.title: Over 16 - Ind 67/5
details.content: A boundary off the last ball. Jadhav trying to show some resistance.

details.title: Over 16 - Ind 67/5
details.content: A boundary off the last ball. Jadhav trying to show some resistance.
Pandya joins in too. Jadhav and Pandya are batting positively with nothing to lose.

details.title: WICKET Kedar Jadhav 9 (13)
details.content: Another one falls! Shadab gets his second! Some good turn! Jadhav scoops one up as the Pakistani skipper calls to take the catch.
India are six down now. Pakistan's intensity on the field is just blowing the Men in Blue away!
Shadab Khan - what a revelation !! Youngest player to play Champions Trophy makes a mark in the summit clash.

details.title: Over 18 - Ind 80/6
details.content: Jadeja is the next one in. Can he make a difference? India is desperate now.
Pandya gives something for the Indian fans to cheer.

details.title: SIX
details.content: Hardik Pandya is hanging in there. A solid shot down the ground.
Almost a run out there! The last thing India would want right now is that! Jadeja scampers back to make it to the crease!

details.title: Over 19 - Ind 89/6
details.content: Jadeja and Pandya have an uphill climb to get India across the line. Pakistan continue to hold it tight.

details.title: Celebrations begin in Islamabad
details.content: via GIPHY

Pakistan have been unbelievable today! Always manage to produce talented players and performances in big tournaments.

— Moeen Ali (@MoeenAli) June 18, 2017

details.title: 100 UP FOR INDIA
details.content: Better late than never.

details.title: Over 21 - Ind 102/6
details.content: A boundary from that over. Jadeja and Pandya are trying to hold on, building up India's most decent partnership so far.

details.title: HARDIK LEONIDAS PANDYA
details.content: Two sixes in a row !

details.title: PANDYA GETS FIFTY
details.content:
Pandya scores the fastest fifty in an ODI-final.

50 for Hardik Pandya!

Brought up with a huge six!

Taken just 32 balls.https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/Sm88Dpr7hn

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017
22 runs off this over! One more ball to go! Hardik Pandya still believes!

details.title: Over 23 - Ind 128/6
details.content: Back-to-back sixes for Pandya! But, is it enough to shake up Pakistan?

details.title: Over 24 - Ind 134/6
details.content: A decent over that. Pakistan still seem to be hovering over for a wicket.

details.title: Over 25 - Ind 137/6
details.content: At the halfway mark, it has been Pakistan's game so far! India's strength, their batting failed today and that has made all the difference in the world.
Pandya dealing in SIXES! India's lone warrior gives fans something to cheer for.
Another huge one Hardik Pandya ! Indian fans gain some life.

details.title: Over 26 - Ind 152/6
details.content: 15 runs off that over. But, is a wicket around the corner?

Yes, there is something about @hardikpandya7. Need to look after him.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: WICKET Hardik Pandya 76 (43)
details.content:
An unnecessary run out! India's last hope departs after a good start! A real shame indeed! 

WICKET!

Hardik Pandya's cameo is over. Run out with both batsmen at the same end.

India 152/7https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/7x2VaFMKcn

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: HARDIK DISMISSED
details.content: India loss their best chance to a communication mishap.

details.title: ASHWIN UP
details.content: Last recognised batting pair in crease for the defending champions.

details.title: Over 27 - Ind 154/7
details.content: India are down in the dumps now. Only a miracle can save them now.

details.title: BOWLING CHANGE WORKS
details.content:
\

An unsettled R Jadeja gives a catch to the slip.

WICKET!

Ravinra Jadeja edges to Babar Azam in the slips to leave India 156/8https://t.co/Cer70pIRoh #PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/PvJeFWR6qn

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: WICKET Ravindra Jadeja 15 (26)
details.content: First a miscommunication from him cost the dismissal of Hardik Pandya and now he throws his own wicket away, edging one to slip. Not a good day for Jadeja!

It is now two years to the ICC World Cup. The preparation should begin and team selections henceforth should reflect that.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017

details.title: Over 28 - Ind 156/8
details.content: India is just losing it. All pakistan's game now and their bowlers deserve it.

details.title: OUT
details.content: Pakistan just one wicket away from the Cup.

details.title: WICKET Ravichandran Ashwin 1 (3)
details.content: Nine down! India have just completely been demolished by some brilliant bowling! Hassan Ali gets another!

details.title: Yep.
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Over 29 - Ind 156/9
details.content: Pakistan are just an inch away from glory! What a performance with both bat and ball!
Amir's big three wickets set it up for the green brigade. India never really recovered from there.

details.title: Over 30 - Ind 158/9
details.content: 30 overs are up. Pakistan are still waiting for that last wicket.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Jasprit Bumrah are just delaying the inevitable now.

details.title: PAKISTAN WIN
details.content: Sarfraz takes the catch and Pakistan win!! Hassan Ali finishes what Mohammad Amir began!

details.title: WICKET! IT IS ALL OVER
details.content: The game ends in the winning captain;s hand as Sarfaraz Ahmed collects a loose shot by Bumrah without fail.

CHAMPIONS! 🇵🇰 #CT17 pic.twitter.com/HH8idDXhU4

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: WICKET Jasprit Bumrah 1 (9)
details.content: That's the final wicket. India stood no chance against the heat of Pakistan's pace attack.

Congratulations Pakistan. Worthy winners after a dramatic comeback to the Champions Trophy

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 18, 2017
An emotional Pakistan team huddle to celebrate their hard-earned win! Take a bow, Sarfraz Ahmed!

Victory huddle ✌️#PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/LkbXWxp3WU

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

details.title: CONGRATULATIONS PAKISTAN !
details.content: Pakistan are the ICC Champions Trophy 2017 winners, defeating the hot favourites India by 180 runs. The Men in Blue's hopes of becoming  the first side in history to defend the title after Australia shatters after a miserable performance with both bat and ball.

Respect 🤝#PAKvIND #CT17 pic.twitter.com/8oR7Pen75Z

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017

Big day 4 Pak, played like champions 2day n won it with ease! Admire the energy n enthusiasm 4m each player. Congrats Pakistan! #CT17 #PCB

— Umar55 (@mdk_gul) June 18, 2017
FINAL SCORE: Ind 158 all out (30.3 overs)
Pakistan write the perfect fairy tale, the last ranked team now lift the title.

Batting first in big games, the age old theory coming true once again.
But very disappointing from India today.#INDvPAK

— Mohammad Kaif (@MohammadKaif) June 18, 2017

This is my team. This is my Pakistan. Pakistan all the way .... Congratulations! :) #PAKvIND #CT17 #PakistanZindabad

— Inzamam ul Haq (@InziTheLegend) June 18, 2017
Great scenes at the oval. A sea of green.
Presentation ceremony underway at the Oval.
Trophy presentations begin.
The player of the match in the final is Pakistan's young Fakhar Zaman for his 114.
Shikhar Dhawan wins the Golden Bat award for the highest run scorer.
Hassan Ali wins the Golden Ball award for the highest wicket-taker of the tournament.

details.title: MAN OF THE MATCH
details.content: Fakhar Zaman selected Man of the Match for his brilliant century. (AP)

details.title: PLAYER OF THE TOURNAMENT
details.content: Hassan Ali is the player of the tournament. Pakistan's new-found bowling spearhead! (AP)

details.title: LEADING RUN SCORER
details.content: The Indian opener has been the most successful batsman in the tournament bagging 338 runs. (AP)
Players from Pakistan and India collect their medals one by one. Great performance in the tournament by both teams!

Congratulations Pakistan. Exceptional performance in the final today. #CT17

— Steve Smith (@stevesmith49) June 18, 2017

details.title: PAKISTAN TAKE THE CUP!
details.content: The Pakistan flag flies high at the Oval! As the crowd cheers, the Pakistan team collect the trophy to celebrate!
The Pakistan team take a victory lap around the ground!

Champions! 🇵🇰 #CT17 pic.twitter.com/rKEIPKYnGm

— ICC (@ICC) June 18, 2017
